list-item.p: Even in the best laboratories, aetiological agents are diagnosed in only about 50% of patients with encephalitis in Asia.
Japanese encephalitis virus accounts for 50% of the diagnosed pathogens in areas where vaccination is not universally accessible.
The burden of disease is particularly borne by children of rural, economically fragile families.
Multidisciplinary research may help improve knowledge and practice in detecting, treating, and preventing encephalitis in the Mekong region.
